sentences.en: A venerable building -- grey , even in the midst of the hoary landscape.
sentences.cn: 一座尊严的建筑 —— 便是在一片白茫茫景色之中也很幽暗.

sentences.en: But our Venerable Master has already promised.
sentences.cn: 然而这是老太爷答应了的.

sentences.en: But that's what our Venerable Master has decided. I must obey him.
sentences.cn: 然而这是老太爷的意思,我也只得听他的话.

sentences.en: Columbia was a young city compared to venerable Charleston.
sentences.cn: 与历史悠久的查尔斯顿相比，哥伦比亚是个年轻的城市。

sentences.en: He was about sixty - five years of age, venerable.
sentences.cn: 他今年65岁光景, 老态龙钟.

sentences.en: Her Chinese friends referred to the empress as their venerable ancestor.
sentences.cn: 她的中国朋友们称那位皇后是令他们尊敬的祖先。

sentences.en: Her Chinese friends referred to the Empress as their venerable ancestor.
sentences.cn: 她的中国朋友们说这位女皇是他们值得敬仰的祖先。

sentences.en: It grew on a venerable and venerated family tree.
sentences.cn: 它长在一棵历史悠久、受人尊敬的“家族树”上.

sentences.en: Lying with eyes shut, the Venerable Master Kao dozed, snoring slightly.
sentences.cn: 两只眼睛闭着, 鼻孔里微微发出一点声息.

sentences.en: People respectfully called him the venerable Zhu.
The cathedral is a venerable building.
sentences.cn: 主教座堂是神圣庄严的建筑.
德高望重的吉他演奏家帕特·马蒂诺

sentences.en: The Venerable Master Kao was seldom at home during the day.
sentences.cn: 高老太爷还是跟往常一样,白天很少在家.

sentences.en: Venerable dailies such as the Tokyo Times have shut down.
sentences.cn: 像《东京时报》之类的一些有名望的日报已经停刊了。

sentences.en: Venerable oaks forms a sylvan archway.
sentences.cn: 古老的栎树形成一条林荫拱道.

trans.tran_cn: 令人尊重的，庄严的，珍贵的，副主教
trans.tran_en: formal a venerable person or thing is respected because of their great age, experience etc – often used humorously
